intro: Eriospermum volkmanniae, commonly known as the Volkmann's eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a compact cluster. Eriospermum volkmanniae is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
